titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph S. Dey Public Cartman license 1974.156
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:55 +0000.

did.unittitle: Joseph S. Dey public cartman license
did.abstract: A license issued to Joseph S. Day as a public cartman by the Village of Brooklyn, signed by Joshua Sands.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Joseph S. Dey was a resident of Brooklyn who lived at 30 Cranberry Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A license issued to Joseph S. Day as a public cartman by the Village of Brooklyn, signed by Joshua Sands.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Joseph S. Dey Public Cartman license, 1974.156, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
